Ingredients.7: 12 ounces raw peeled and deveined shrimp

Ingredients.9: 2 teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)

Ingredients.10: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Colby Jack cheese

Directions.1: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add andouille and cook for 2 minutes. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes more. Add bell peppers and cook for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in celery.

Directions.2: Line a baking sheet with foil and place tortilla chips on top. Cover chips with the sausage mixture.

Directions.3: Place shrimp in a bowl; add oil and seafood seasoning. Stir to coat. Place shrimp in the same skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Scatter shrimp on top of the sausage mixture. Sprinkle Colby Jack cheese over the nachos.

Directions.4: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to low. Broil nachos until cheese has melted, about 3 minutes.
